member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.CommandAttribute
member.summary: Marks the class as a Command.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.CommandAttribute.Name
member.summary: Name of the command

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.CommandAttribute.Help
member.summary: Displayed in the help for the command and any aliases

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.CommandAttribute.Aliases
member.summary: The command's aliases

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.CommandAttribute.DefaultOptions
member.summary: A string of options that are parsed before the command line options

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.DebugCommandAttribute
member.summary: Marks a class as a Debug-Only command. These commands are only available for debug versions of SOS, but does not appear in shipping builds.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.OptionAttribute
member.summary: Marks the property as a Option.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.OptionAttribute.Name
member.summary: Name of the option i.e "--pid"

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.OptionAttribute.Help
member.summary: Displayed in the help for the option and any aliases

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.OptionAttribute.Aliases
member.summary: The option's aliases i.e "-p"

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.ArgumentAttribute
member.summary: Marks the property the command Argument.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.ArgumentAttribute.Name
member.summary: Name of the argument

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.ArgumentAttribute.Help
member.summary: Displayed in the help for the argument

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.CommandInvokeAttribute
member.summary: Marks the function to invoke to execute the command.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.HelpInvokeAttribute
member.summary: Marks the function to invoke to return the alternate help for command. The function returns a string. The Argument and Option properties of the command are not set.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.FilterInvokeAttribute
member.summary: Marks the function to invoke to filter a command. The function returns a bool; true if the command is supported. The Argument and Option properties of the command are not set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.FilterInvokeAttribute.Message
member.summary: Message to display if the filter fails

member.summary: The start address of the region.

member.summary: The end address of the region.

member.summary: The size of the region.

member.summary: The type of the region. (Image/Private/Mapped)

member.summary: The state of the region. (Commit/Free/Reserve)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IMemoryRegion.Protection
member.summary: The protection of the region.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IMemoryRegion.Usage
member.summary: What this memory is being used for. This field is a best attempt at determining what the memory is being used for, and may be marked as Unknown if certain debugging symbols are not available.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IMemoryRegion.Image
member.summary: If this file is an image or mapped file, this property may be non-null and contain its path.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IMemoryRegionService
member.summary: Enumerate virtual address regions, their protections, and usage.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IMemoryService
member.summary: Memory service

member.name: P:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IMemoryService.PointerSize
member.summary: Returns the pointer size of the target

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IMemoryService.ReadMemory(System.UInt64,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Read memory out of the target process.
member.param: The address of memory to read
The buffer to read memory into
The number of bytes actually read out of the target process
member.returns: true if any bytes were read at all, false if the read failed (and no bytes were read)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IMemoryService.WriteMemory(System.UInt64,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Write memory into target process for supported targets.
member.param: The address of memory to write
The number of bytes successfully written
member.returns: true if any bytes where written, false if write failed

member.summary: Target for this module.

member.summary: Debugger specific module index

member.summary: Gets the base address of the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModule.ImageSize
member.summary: Returns the image size of module in memory.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModule.IndexFileSize
member.summary: Gets the specific file size of the image used to index it on the symbol server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModule.IndexTimeStamp
member.summary: Gets the timestamp of the image used to index it on the symbol server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModule.BuildId
member.summary: Build id on Linux and MacOS, otherwise empty value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModule.IsPEImage
member.summary: Returns true if Windows PE format image (native or IL).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModule.IsManaged
member.summary: Returns true if managed or IL assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModule.IsFileLayout
member.summary: Returns true if the PE module is layout is file. False, layout is loaded image. If null, not a PE image.

member.summary: Returns PDB information for Windows PE modules (managed or native).

member.summary: Returns the Linux or MacOS symbol file name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModule.GetVersionData
member.summary: Returns the version information for the modules.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModule.GetVersionString
member.summary: Returns the file version string containing the build version and commit id.

member.summary: Downloads and returns the metadata for the assembly.

member.summary: Provides module info

member.summary: Enumerate all the modules in the target

member.summary: Get the module from the module index

member.summary: Get the module from the module base address

member.summary: Finds the module that contains the address.

member.summary: Finds the module(s) with the specified module name. It is the platform dependent name that includes the "lib" prefix on xplat and the extension (dll, so or dylib).

member.summary: Create a module instance
member.exception: thrown if imageBase or imageSize is 0

member.summary: Gets the entrypoint module for the target.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.SymbolStatus
member.summary: The status of the symbols for a module.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.SymbolStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The status of the symbols is unknown. The symbol may be loaded or unloaded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.SymbolStatus.Loaded
member.summary: The debugger has successfully loaded symbols for this module.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.SymbolStatus.NotLoaded
member.summary: The debugger does not have symbols loaded for this module.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.SymbolStatus.ExportOnly
member.summary: The debugger does not have symbols loaded for this module, but it is able to report addresses of exported functions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModuleSymbols
member.summary: Module symbol lookup

member.summary: Returns the symbol name and displacement if found
member.param: symbol name (without the module name prepended)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModuleSymbols.TryGetSymbolAddress(System.String,System.UInt64@)
member.summary: Returns the address of a module symbol if found
member.param: symbol name (without the module name prepended)

member.summary: Searches for a type by name

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IModuleSymbols.GetSymbolStatus
member.summary: Returns the status of the symbols for this module. This function may cause the debugger to load symbols for this module, which may take a long time.
member.returns: The status of symbols for this module.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IRemoteMemoryService
member.summary: Allocates and frees memory in the target process. Currently this is only available on Windows debuggers (dbgeng).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IRemoteMemoryService.AllocateMemory(System.UInt64,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt64@)
member.summary: Allocate memory in the target process. Similar to VirtualAllocEx on Windows.
member.param: size of memory region in bytes
Type of memory allocation. See the MEM_* constants.
memory protection flags for the pages to be allocated. See the PAGE_* constants.
member.returns: true if the allocation succeeded, false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.IRemoteMemoryService.FreeMemory(System.UInt64,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Free memory the target process for supported targets. Similar to VirtualFreeEx on Windows.
member.param: The address of memory to free
size of memory region in bytes
Type of memory allocation. See the MEM_* constants.
member.returns: true if the requested memory range was properly freed, false otherwise

member.name: T:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.ServiceContainer
member.summary:
This service provider and container implementation caches the service instance. Calls the service factory for the type if not already instantiated and cached and if no factory, chains to the parent service container.
This implementations allows multiple instances of the same service type to be registered. They are queried by getting the IEnumerable of the service type. If the non-enumerable service type is queried and there are multiple instances, an exception is thrown. The IRuntimeService implementation uses this feature to enumerate all the IRuntimeProvider instances registered in the system.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.ServiceContainer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Type,Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.ServiceFactory})
member.summary: Build a service provider with parent provider and service factories
member.param: search this provider if service isn't found in this instance or null
service factories to initialize provider or null

member.name: M:Microsoft.Diagnostics.DebugServices.ServiceContainer.AddService(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Add a service instance. Multiple instances for the same type are not allowed.

member.summary: Add a service instance. Multiple instances for the same type are not allowed.

member.summary: Dispose of the instantiated services.

member.summary: Returns the instance of the service or returns null if service doesn't exist
